alert.note: Alert for Cobb; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cobb and central Fulton Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Jim R Miller Park, or near Marietta, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Marietta, Mountain Park, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Smyrna, Kennesaw, Powder Springs, Austell, Fair Oaks, Mount Bethel, White Water Park, Sweat Mountain, Lost Mountain Park, Vinings, Jim R Miller Park, Due West, Sandy Plains, Bolton, and Dobbins Air Reserve Base. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
